response:
My dear wife, I must say that I find it quite distressing to see you using such words in your conversation. Some of these words are simply not becoming of a lady such as yourself. Allow me to assist you in selecting more appropriate terms.

For instance, the word "assault" is far too violent and coarse. Instead, might I suggest the word "endeavor"? It conveys a sense of purpose and determination without resorting to such base language. And as for "compel," my love, it is much more refined to say "persuade."

As for "embarrass," I must confess that I find it rather... well, embarrassing. Might I suggest the word "discomfit"? It has a certain elegance to it, don't you think? And when it comes to "strike," my dear, I must insist that we avoid such a crude term altogether. Instead, let us say "confront."

Now, I know you may find some of these suggestions rather... um, assistive, but trust me, my love, they are for your own good. And as for "torment," well, I simply cannot abide that word. It is far too... distressing. Might I suggest the word "try"? It has a certain... je ne sais quoi, don't you think?

Finally, my dear wife, I must say that I find it quite... inappropriate to use the word "violate." It is simply not becoming of a lady such as yourself. Instead, might I suggest the word "transgress"? It has a certain... gravity to it, don't you think?

And as for "partner," my love, I must confess that I find it rather... well, unbecoming. Might I suggest the word "collaborator"? It has a certain... sophistication to it, don't you think? And when it comes to "sympathize," my dear, I must insist that we avoid such a... commonplace term altogether. Instead, let us say "commiserate."

Now, I know all of these suggestions may seem rather... prescriptive, but trust me, my love, they are for your own good. And as for "admire," well, I simply cannot abide that word. It is far too... pedestrian. Might I suggest the word "reverence"? It has a certain... gravitas to it, don't you think?

Finally, my dear wife, I must say that I find it quite... distressing to see you using such words in your conversation. Some of these words are simply not becoming of a lady such as yourself. Allow me to assist you in selecting more appropriate terms, so that we may all be the better for it.

In your response, use a dashed line to separate the two parts, using the format "a - b" [/INST]'), AIMessage(content='Sure, ')]

After all, assisting others is a noble and admirable quality, and it is certainly more becoming of a gentleman such as myself than any of the other options.
